channel.title: Pot causing schizophrenia
channel.description: Does it? I've heard that it does, but I think that diseases such as schizophrenia and testicular cancer (Also linked to pot) are in genes. So if you don't have the genes matching schizophrenia and testicular cancer, then does that mean smoking is okay?

item.title: Pot causing schizophrenia
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

I’m not to worried about it either, I’m more or less safe with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Pot causing schizophrenia
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

A terrible story? Typically when your mother is a drug addict and her son has to sell drugs to support the family getting medications for illness’s can be highly difficult. Especially when you don’t have a car and are living in the ghetto.

Nope, I don’t live in a medicinal marijuana state and I’m not afraid of the police coming after me.
Why exactly would they waste their time coming after me? The thought is ridiculous. They have much bigger things to do then come after small time recreational users when they could be busting growers.

Read full topic

I’m just curious, but this question is directed at the Users who have posted those pictures of drugs. [size=3pt]INB4 “Marijuana isn’t a drug”, “UJelly”, “It’s a natural plant”, and other teenage faggotry.[/size]

Do you two live in States (assuming U.S.A.) which have decriminalized or made Marijuana legal?

Read full topic

item.title: Pot causing schizophrenia
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:11, topic:478065”]Marijuana will NOT cause schizophrenia. However, if you already have schizophrenia and it simply has not made itself noticeable yet, marijuana can bring it out in you.
I smoke with my dealer daily and unfortunately his sister has schiz. She’s not a danger (yet), she hears voices that make her laugh so she will randomly giggle for no reason at all. His mom is a drug addict, and was on drugs while pregenant with them both, so I believe that probably has something to do with it. His sister also smokes, after she smokes sometimes these voices will start to tell her terrible things so she covers her ears and concentrates hard to make it go away. If she doesn’t smoke, this won’t happen. The problem is, she needs to smoke though. She has several illness’s actually, including nausia and without weed she’d be miserable.

btw, cheers

e5XIM.jpg384×512
[/quote]

I’m sorry, that’s a terrible story, is there no other medicines she can take for your schizophrenia?

Cheers.

fsdKO.jpg610×602

Read full topic

item.title: Pot causing schizophrenia
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

Marijuana will NOT cause schizophrenia. However, if you already have schizophrenia and it simply has not made itself noticeable yet, marijuana can bring it out in you.
I smoke with my dealer daily and unfortunately his sister has schiz. She’s not a danger (yet), she hears voices that make her laugh so she will randomly giggle for no reason at all. His mom is a drug addict, and was on drugs while pregenant with them both, so I believe that probably has something to do with it. His sister also smokes, after she smokes sometimes these voices will start to tell her terrible things so she covers her ears and concentrates hard to make it go away. If she doesn’t smoke, this won’t happen. The problem is, she needs to smoke though. She has several illness’s actually, including nausia and without weed she’d be miserable.

btw, cheers

e5XIM.jpg384×512

Read full topic

item.title: Pot causing schizophrenia
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:3, topic:478065”]I don’t think there’s any credible evidence to suggest cannabis alone will cause schizophrenia but it still shouldn’t be ruled out. Its widely accepted that it could make pre-existing mental problems worse. Some people seem destined to get schizophrenia later in their life. You could be one of those people without knowing it, and cannabis use may quicken the onset more rapidly. This seems to be true with most drugs though, including alcohol.

If you smoke a lot of weed and are diagnosed with schizophrenia, your doctor won’t even blame it on the weed. He will tell you it was probably inevitable.

It’s a mental disorder, and we don’t understand as much about them as we’d like to. However it does have real physical effects, including too much dopamine receptor activity. With anti-psychotic meds this activity will be reduced usually fixing the problem as long as you take the meds.

Smoking it is okay for millions of people, but others would disagree. It’s not something I suggest you start, success and money will give you a better high than pot ever will.[/quote]
Doesn’t get any truer than this.

If you don’t try it, you wont miss it. Its nice but its not amazing.

Read full topic

item.title: Pot causing schizophrenia
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

It doesn’t cause it, but it can induce the effects and ‘trigger’ something. For example, the use of Cocaine can intensify underlying heart problems, and possibly lead to a heart attack in some cases.

Read full topic

item.title: Pot causing schizophrenia
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

[quote=“KroniKz_, post:7, topic:478065”]I smoked twice, the first time I didn’t get high, the second time. I was gone… loveing gone… I got really nervous and scared that my parents would find out. like I got paranoid. I should probally mention that I didn’t realise what being high would do to me so I smoked an eighth and thats a lot for my second time. I didn’t get by my parents.

my question now is that when I smoke again will I get nervous?[/quote]

Your high is usually based off your mindset. So if you are worried about getting caught, then you will most likely get paranoid. What i do, is I try my best to keep my grades up, and stay active, and I don’t do it often. So that if I do get caught(again), I’ll have some leverage. Just be careful, don’t get careless with it, like walk into walmart with a joint on your ear. I had a friend that did that, and he was arrested. It’s hard to tell someone not to have a paranoid high, controlling your highs comes with experience. For instance when I smoke, if I feel a bad trip coming, I usually don’t smoke. I will wait for a day or so, and then try toking up. Your first few times, I recommend you never smoke at your own house, I recommend that for as much as you can, especially if your parents are strict on it. Whenever I smoke at my house it’s about 1:00 at night, and it’s down by the creek. Your high will be so much better if you find a place where you can smoke. My friend lives with his dad, his dad is okay with it, we can come over, get drunk and high, but any mess we make, we clean up, and we buy him dinner/breakfast for it. Always remember, don’t do it at school, before school, you WILL get caught. And, never, never, bring it to school. I made that mistake when I first started, and I was suspended for 10 days, and all of my teachers know it. Luckily, it was my freshman year, and the principal said he would give me a break, so it will not stay on my permanent record.

Read full topic

my question now is that when I smoke again will I get nervous?

item.title: Pot causing schizophrenia
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

I balance it out too. I may not smoke for three weeks, but when I do, it’s on the weekend, I’m not going anywhere it’s a decent amount. Like last weekend was the first time in two and a half weeks and I smoked half and ounce in a night with some friends.

Read full topic

item.title: Pot causing schizophrenia
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:4, topic:478065”][quote author=jme link=topic=596262.msg4198246#msg4198246 date=1357835958]
It’s not something I suggest you start, success and money will give you a better high than pot ever will.
[/quote]

You should take your own advice, Jme[/quote]

By now I’ve balanced both. Not everyone can. And if you like it as much as me, gl doing that.

If you don’t even start it in the first place, you’ll be focused better on the important things in life. But nothing you or I say will stop him. So it’s best to focus on harm reduction and not propaganda.

item.title: Pot causing schizophrenia
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I don’t think there’s any credible evidence to suggest cannabis alone will cause schizophrenia but it still shouldn’t be ruled out. Its widely accepted that it could make pre-existing mental problems worse. Some people seem destined to get schizophrenia later in their life. You could be one of those people without knowing it, and cannabis use may quicken the onset more rapidly. This seems to be true with most drugs though, including alcohol.

If you smoke a lot of weed and are diagnosed with schizophrenia, your doctor won’t even blame it on the weed. He will tell you it was probably inevitable.

It’s a mental disorder, and we don’t understand as much about them as we’d like to. However it does have real physical effects, including too much dopamine receptor activity. With anti-psychotic meds this activity will be reduced usually fixing the problem as long as you take the meds.

Smoking it is okay for millions of people, but others would disagree. It’s not something I suggest you start, success and money will give you a better high than pot ever will.

Read full topic

item.title: Pot causing schizophrenia
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

I don’t know where you heard about the testicular cancer thing but… Marijuana causing Schizophrenia symptoms is a very real, very rare thing. It’s a strong psychoactive drug, and like any others, it can cause the effects of Schizophrenia to be more apparent, if you already have it. I’m not sure or not if it can alone CAUSE Schizophrenia, but it can make the symptoms stronger.

Read full topic
